emulib.emustudio

Interface SettingsManager


  • public interface SettingsManager
    Settings manager provides methods for reading/storing plug-in settings. It is implemented by the main module. Plug-ins get it within the initialization process.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String AUTO 
      static String NO_GUI 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String readSetting(long pluginID, String settingName)
      Read specified setting from configuration file.
      boolean removeSetting(long pluginID, String settingName)
      Remove specified setting to from a configuration file.
      boolean writeSetting(long pluginID, String settingName, String val)
      Write specified setting to a configuration file.

    • Field Detail

      • NO_GUI

        static final String NO_GUI
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • AUTO

        static final String AUTO
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • readSetting

        String readSetting(long pluginID,
                   String settingName)
        Read specified setting from configuration file. Setting can be arbitrary. It uses configuration file that user chosen after start of the emulator.
        Parameters:
        pluginID - plug-in ID
        settingName - name of wanted setting (without spaces)
        Returns:
        setting if it exists (as a String), or null if not

      • writeSetting

        boolean writeSetting(long pluginID,
                     String settingName,
                     String val)
        Write specified setting to a configuration file. Setting can be arbitrary, except: - nogui - auto It uses configuration file that user has chosen after start of the emulator.
        Parameters:
        pluginID - plug-in ID
        settingName - name of wanted setting (without spaces) to be written
        val - value of the setting (has to be String type)
        Returns:
        true if the setting was successfully written; false otherwise

      • removeSetting

        boolean removeSetting(long pluginID,
                      String settingName)
        Remove specified setting to from a configuration file. Be careful, setting can be arbitrary, except: - nogui - auto It uses configuration file that user chosen after start of the emulator.
        Parameters:
        pluginID - plug-in ID
        settingName - name of wanted setting (without spaces) to be removed
        Returns:
        true if the setting was successfully removed; false otherwise
